topic.title: How to Control the PDF Viewer

body.p: The PDF document may contain settings for the PDF Viewer. In this way the viewing experience is common for all of the readers. For example you can specify the zoom level at which the document is presented, or whether the outline view should be displayed.

There are several CSS properties you can use. These properties should be set on the root element. If they are set on multiple elements, the first one will be taken into account. Let's take some examples:
